verses.roman:
āsana diyā mahāprabhure tāhāṅ vasāilā
dui bhāi tabe ciḍā khāite lāgilā

synonyms: āsana diyā—offering a sitting place; mahāprabhure—unto Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu; tāhāṅ—there; vasāilā—made sit; dui bhāi—the two brothers, tabe—at that time; ciḍā—chipped rice; khāite lāgilā—began to eat.
translation: Lord Nityānanda offered Śrī Caitanya Mahāprabhu a place and had Him sit down. Then together the two brothers began eating chipped rice.
